...Yes. Yes, they should wreck him. That is literally their job description. Zed is an assassin. He is supposed to do well against a squishy target that deals high damage but dies easily. He is supposed to be bad against people who don't die to one combo.

So. Um.

At this point, me too.

But really, if Zed needs buffs, it's because Zed needs buffs; not any other reason.

EDIT: meh I'm probably mistaking...

In my opinion, mages were buffed quite heavily with the AP item changes recently.
I can build a variety of items with more components, making it easier for me to build a full item (instead of waiting for that expensive 1600 NLR)

They buffed the items that were too weak and improved QoL a bit. In some cases they moved the power around from one place to another. But there was very little if any straight buffing. The big problem is they didn't make mana better for anyone and they didn't improve the laning phase. Zed crushes mana mages in lane and that's the real problem that wasn't fixed at all.

That's true, it's much easier to buy NLR now, though it gives.. 60 ap instead of the former 80? I'm really wondering how the items for the mages changed power-wise, since the two other 120 AP items got nerfed to give only 100 due to the Cap being buffed. Am I the only mage player that doesn't necessarily buy Rabadon each game? I'm certain only for Rylai's that it's effect has been buffed (the slow is epic now), but I don't know for others. So, is their build buffed ap wise only if they include Rabadon in the build?

What does this have anything to do with...anything related to this thread? Did you just feel the need to defend Zed against my perceived attacks?

Is that a comment on his unwillingness at finding himself in an antagonist role when all he wanted to do was break petty taboo and bring a new way to expand body and mind to mankind, or is it just that he really doesn't like getting smacked in the face for true damage with a giant paddle that Garen confuses for a sword?
I wish I was deep enough for it to be the former, I really do.

We understand that saturating the champion pool with Zed counters is likely to make him less strong, however the thing is that Zed is balanced against squishy targets - buffing him any further would make him totally out of control and back in the perma pick/ban status mid-lane. It's very unlikely that the juggernauts will warp the current meta of that position, yet it is where these buffs will have the most impact. Please reconsider those changes before releasing the reworks to see how they will actually affect him.

The juggernaut reworks aren't at all being released to help counter Zed. My apologies if that's the impression I gave.

As an assassin, Zed _should_ be strong against squishy targets. They should have a fair chance to defend themselves (especially early in the game), but the upper hand should probably be his.

Thanks for clearing that up Repertoir - but that brings me to another question - Zed is currently seen as a very efficient assassin who can ult on a target, 100-0 them and shadow away with actually little possible counterplay _from_ the target.  He has a good laning, phenomenal wave-clear, and a lot of kill potential. Has he been under performing in a specific area?

{{item:3157}} 
{{item:3140}} 

Counter building is part of counter play. These nullify his ultimate and make it a nightmare for a Zed to ult a target with either item. 

"I shouldn't be forced to rush hourglass; muh...muh mana re--"

Stop.

You won't necessarily have many regen to poke or harass with. You're right. It's a tradeoff. But Zed is DESIGNED to be more powerful than most mages at level 6. His laning and roaming is *designed* to be strong. So, no, you may not get to rush the classic Morellonomicon start. You may have to build a QSS before you finish your Phantom Dancer. 

"These items are money h----"

No, they're not money sinks if they can make a champion's main damaging ability absolutely useless on you. 

The problem most players have is mentally taking themselves out of lane and thinking big picture. Yes, a QSS makes you a weaker ADC than your lane opponent. Are you holistically weaker in the long run? No; you're now Zed-proof.

I don't really understand why you downvoted my question, since I only asked Repertoire the reasoning behind the Zed buffs since he's in a good state. 

Expecting all participants in a game to build zhonyas or QSS is a bad way to say that a character has meaningful counterplay, especially since in zhonya's case _it more or less counters every skill, active, and summoner spells in the game_.

I didn't actually down vote it, but I can bump it back to 1 for you. o.o

Yes, it does counter every skill in the game, but most champions aren't as entirely dependent on their ultimate as Zed. Those that are have either shorter cooldowns (Akali, Katarina) or have decent power without the ult and can stall/contribute without being nearly entirely useless (Veigar). 

Zed's basic ability scaling is pretty mediocre at best; 100% bonus AD scaling on a single target is nothing compared to, say, Talon's 140% or Yasuo's 100% total AD. Yes, his base damage makes clearing waves, but his scaling is....average. He's safe, though. 

As for him underperforming, I think the buff is targetted specifically towards his laning; leaving a whole second before returning to shadow makes him ulting in the early game very dangerous; for an early/mid game carry, that's not good. However, this probably will have very little effect on his teamfighting.

Aren't the proposed buffs to Zed to reduce the blink-back time on R with rank? This seems like a pretty sound approach to me, tbh. .75 and .5 seconds are long enough in the early and mid-game for a single defender to hit some cc on him when he comes in, and though .25 seconds is pretty short, there should be teammates around to help then.

At the end of the day, Zed is probably supposed to be pretty strong against immobile skillshot mages, similar to how juggernauts are supposed to be strong against him.

> At the end of the day, Zed is probably supposed to be pretty strong against immobile skillshot mages, similar to how juggernauts are supposed to be strong against him.

And if the answer is so hes not bullied so hard then the same can be said for zed vs immobile mages. And play lux and zyra against a zed and tell me me how much time u have to land your snares and tell me how .5 seconds is enough
as a rioter you of all people should know that "just counterpick them" isn't a way to justify a champion as weak

He's not saying "Pick Garen beat Zed". He's clarifying that with new champions that are A. Tanky and B. Dealing Damage, Zed might need a tad help against them.

 You know how the Tank Meta almost destroyed Zed, before the nerf to his ult? Well imagine how these guys might treat him.

Zed should lose to those kind of champions,not kill him.Assassins as a class exist to kill ADCs& the enemy midlaner (and support on occasion),if they are able to  defeat tanks&fighters without breaking a sweat,well  then we have a problem.
You're assuming a .5 second delay is going to kill a tanky champ. No, its not. It's going to give Zed a bit more breathing room then he had.

You are missing the point.If they buff zed because he needs more _breathing room_ against champion who are supposed to counter him,they are also buffing him against champion he alredy wrecks in lane.

On the other hand,they buffed Zed to have it easier against champion that could defeat him,while mages that he wrecks,didn't recive any changes to have more_ breathing room_ against him.They buffed a champion who can deal with his counters easier,so why not do the same with mages?Because they aren't flashy?
If these types of champions beat assassins; assassins might as well not be played then. Just play tanky bruisers with a jungler and an ADC with their support.
Never said assassins should lose,jsut that shouldn't be able to eaasily defeat those kind of champions,like Zed did in the begining of the season to tanks.Killing everything and everyone.

Like you said; it shouldn't be easy. But I was referring to what Light2401 said. **"Zed might need a tad help against them."** If this next patch makes tanks and bruisers a bit stronger, assassins might get outclassed if they don't get a little bit of help.
Flawed logic if bruisers and assassins get buffed,mages won't see much play.**AGAIN**
That's "meta" for you; things get buffed and nerfed.

It seems like assassins can be broken as long as RIOT is willing to leave them as that,but mages get nerfed immediately.Nearly the  whole mage class was fucked by the mana regen ˝changes˝,I don't really remember any compensation buffs.
That's not what I'm saying, though what I said could be interpreted as that >.<

I'm a little concerned for Zed being rebuffed back, because the whole reason that his ultimate was so toxic was because Zed could faceroll all of his abilities to max out the detonation damage, and then pop back to safety in less than a second, guaranteeing a dead target with little risk to Zed.  Zed's already mobile enough as is.  If he gets caught out by Garen, he deserves to get spinnedtowinned to death.
Especially when armor is being nerfed.

Meh, I guess I see what you mean, but personally I find the meta full of cc and devourer junglers a true pain in the ass whenever I use Zed.

It's probably because I'm bad with him or something, but, I doubt this buff will make him pick or ban. It's just a .5 second delay on returning to his ult's shadow, right?

Yes that's the buff. Honestly it's nothing BIG but that will draw back the attention of a players who played him before the 1 sec nerf and I really don't want to see him literally unviable because when champion is constantly banned I consider him unviable because I can't play it.

As for Devourer...I would not be happy if Riot balances the game around it because Devourer won't be here  forever. We all know how boken and impossible to balance devourer is. If you nerf devourer no one uses it, if you buff it, 5 weak/balanced champions that benefots from devourer are automatically becoming broken as fuck.

Problems with Devourer:

1. 30 stacks is too much and it makes Players to farm all day long = no ganks.

2. If there are less than 30 stacks, power spike would happen to early = retarded and broken.

3. At 20 + stack Devourer champions are literally outshining every other jungle type champions which makes JNG champ pool really poor. I am not talking about LCS and shit...I doubt anyone of you would say that Stacked Warwick or Master YI are a joke....don't even want to talk about Shyvana.

4. Devourer meta literally kills jungle diversity. The only non Devourer junglers that are worth to have in team atm are Elise, Diana and really, really good Lee Sin, other than that you are going to get rekt because Devourers are greedy, they will counter jungle the shit out of you if you are tank, they know you cant kill them, by counterjungling, they will get their stacks faster leaving you without farm and gold.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Devourer is a good Idea but it simply doesn't work for this game, it's either useless or broken as hell, there's no ''In between''.
It's actually more efficient to get stacks by ganking, if your jungler never ganks he's playing it wrong. Devoured forces players to gank more wisely, which I like.
Best thing to do is gank bot, get assists or kills on the bot, then take scuttle and dragon for a mass of stacks.

The ult nerf isn't what made him weak. The resurgence of tanks and the existance (and price reduction) of {{item:3157}} is what makes him weak. 

Also many of the new champs {{champion:245}} {{champion:223}} {{champion:429}} have a "Fuck your death mark" ability, which essentially removes him from the game since he is so dependent on his ult to do his job.

That nerf came well after Zed had fallen from tier one. A partial revert of that nerf is more of a QOL fix than an actual buff.
Disagree. No I'm not being saracastic. Zed is not good in his current state but whatever buffs they're giving him need to be carefully considered so he doesn't become as cancer as he was pre nerf.

I can't say this buff is going to have a massive impact, because the original nerf to make him unable to immediately return to his original shadow actually didn't destroy him(Just made him have to rely a bit more on his W shadow). Though, adding a little bit more reliability into the ability definitely will make him a bit more slippery when it comes to avoiding many of the hard CC abilities that are common today
